ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_women] Hulloooo!
ygData.msgSnippet: I m Viv, and play various chars on Tunare and Morell-Thule. Welcome to the list Viv!  It sounds to me like we are kindred spirits.  I play mostly on Brell
ygData.messageBody:
I'm Viv, and play various chars on Tunare and Morell-Thule.

Welcome to the list Viv!  It sounds to me like we are kindred spirits.  I play mostly on Brell though I did create a char on Morell-Thule when it first came up. 

There's a coupla things I've always thought of asking other eq
girls.. firstly, I know a lot of guys play female chars, and I've
tried a few times making male chars but just felt silly playing them
and ended up deleting them within the first level or so. Is it just
me? Have I got too much wussiness factor in me? Or am I just a
mediocre role-player? Or both?!?! ;)

I only tried playing a male character once and it felt just too strange.  In fact, I also have trouble playing the less feminine style characters.  I find myself drawn to the graphics and so finally gave up.  I like the sexy little female things like wood elves, humans, and barbarians.  I think it is because I'll never have a young perky body again and I miss it.  Getting old has very negative impact on the body (the mind, on the other hand, makes it an almost fair trade).

Also.. has anyone else had their heart broken in eq? Silly question I
know, but i guess I just want reassurance that I'm not alone here ;P

More than once, in fact.  And I don't think it's a silly question or even silly.  The game is so immersive that I have found it has a greater emotional impact on me than my real life.  Now, perhaps that is because my real life is stable and very happy and my biggest worry is finding a good landscape architect. 

But recently when the RL girlfriend of my in-game fiancee decided to be jealous and paranoid and asked him to stop seeing me I was heartbroken.  The game just felt so flat without that relationship.  I think a big reason I'm not playing right now, other than being on vacation for the month, has been the loss of that relationship.

In fact, I met a guy the other day whose heart was broken by a girl
in eq, so it's not just a girlie thing i guess..

No, I know a young man who has been through three heartbreaking relationships in the course of my knowing him.  For him Norrath presents a way of "testing the waters" of relationships as he is just starting college this year. 

Btw, i'm in Australia in rl, and my Tunare chars are Athens, Rynni
and Lrynn (tho Lrynn may be taking a break..) and on Morell-Thule are
Jhasper, Leilanni and Volare.

Iceiallana and Cerres

Brell Server
